Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Ralph Andersen

records.addlTxt:
OFF RECORD 8:28 AM Defendant John Ralph Andersen appeared by video.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for John Ralph Andersen.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses Atty Pollak on Status. Atty Pollak states the DEF has another case for Revocation and requests for a new date. Court sets a new date.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:09 PM Defendant John Ralph Andersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for John Ralph Andersen.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Pollak  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.

1:09 PM Defendant John Ralph Andersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for John Ralph Andersen.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Pollak indicates motion hearing, four corners, and makes argument for motion.   Court reviews the criminal complaint following Attny Pollak motion argument.    State opposes motion, and makes argument.   Court interjects and asks questions of the State.  Discussion follows.  State continues argument.  Attny Pollak emails Jury Instruction 1347, all parties review, and discussion continues.   Attny Pollak continues argument.   Discussion continues.   Court makes finding and denies motion.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Supplemental Discovery Demand
Motion hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:47 AM Defendant John Ralph Andersen in court, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for John Ralph Andersen. Attorney Bruce Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reporter appears by zoom.  State calls witness, Deputy Jordan Price, Clerk Torstenson, sworn in witness.  State begins examination.  10:49 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness. State continues examination.  10:51 AM  Attny Pollak makes Objection, Revelance.  State refers to Count 1.  Attny Pollak withdraws objection.  10:52 AM  State tenders witness.  10:52 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.   10:54 AM Attny Pollak no further questions.  10:54 AM  State re-direct.   Attny Pollak no re-cross.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.   

Attny Pollak filed motion request hearing to be set.   JA to set motion hearing and Arraignment.
Review scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Dismiss Count 1

records.addlTxt:
11:31 AM Defendant John Ralph Andersen appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) appears in person.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NG Plea to Counts 4 and 5.  Court sets preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 10:45 am.

11:42 AM  Defendant  John Ralph Andersen in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty  Stephanie Thomas-Schmidt (special appearance) appearing by video.   Kenneth Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE qualification to be determined for public defender, DEF refused to speak to PD.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt  argues bond.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 6/22/2022 at 11:15 AM.
